description.narrative: (Bangladesh): .Bangladesh has been a Tier Two Watchlist country in the DOS Trafficking in Persons Report for the last three years, for not meeting the minimum standards of Trafficking Victims' Protection Act. Through its Bangladesh Counter Trafficking-in-Persons (BC/TIP) activity USAID/Bangladesh is helping to reduce human trafficking and child marriage, improve access to justice and aid trafficking and child marriage survivors. BC/TIP supports the Bangladesh National Plan of Action for combating human trafficking, 2018-2022. In alignment with the Sustainable Development Goals USAID will: train counter-trafficking and gender-violence committees; assist local officials, teachers, parents, students, and community leaders to address human-trafficking, child-marriage and survivor support; train GOB officials on safe-migration policies and practices; and, support informed decision making by potential migrant workers. The activity will also advocate for improved quality of shelter care, including legal aid, health and psycho-social services, and livelihood-skills training for Bangladeshi and Rohingya populations. Finally BC/TIP will support reintegration of returnee migrant workers into the community, reducing their susceptibility to radicalization. ..This activity supports the U.S. National Security Strategy, State-USAID Joint Strategic Plan Goal Two, and U.S. government's objectives to protect the vulnerable, promote human rights, and increase citizen confidence in governance..
